newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: EU 14 refinery output falls 0.7 pct in Aug - Euroil.
newsitem.headline: EU 14 refinery output falls 0.7 pct in Aug - Euroil.

text.p: Net refinery output in the 14 states of the European Union, excluding Sweden, fell in August, most noticeably for gasoline, Stichting Euroil stock said in its latest monthly report.

Refinery output in August fell by 80,000 barrels per day (0.7 percent) from July to 11.739 million bpd, while refinery crude intake was down 132,000 bpd (1.2 percent) to 11.095 million bpd. This represented a utilisation rate of 88.05 percent, against 89.10 percent in July.
Throughput was also 75,000 bpd (0.5 percent) down from August 1995, although the utilisation rate was up from 87.67 percent.
Month-on-month, total net output fell sharpest in Italy, by 47,000 bpd to 1.707 million bpd in August.
Of the products, gasoline and fuel oil production fell, but middle distillate and naphtha output rose.
Gasoline production was down 66,000 bpd (2.0 percent) in August to 3.215 million bpd, a 3.5 percent fall year-on-year.
Middle distallate output rose 26,000 bpd (0.5 percent) in August to 5.209 million bpd, a 0.6 percent rise from August 1995.
Fuel oil production fell 19,000 bpd (1.1 percent) in August to 1.680 million bpd, a 0.1 percent rise year-on-year.
Naphtha output rose 14,000 bpd (1.6 percent) in August to 894,000 bpd, a 5.4 percent increase on August 1995.
They are based on a nameplate capacity of 12.6 million bpd. Refinery intake represents crude only and excludes natural gas liquids, feedstocks and other inputs.
